column2: Contig length at which 50% of total bases in assembly are in contigs of that length or greater.
Number of contigs.
Number of chromosomes and plasmids in full assembly.
Number of genomic regions defined in full assembly.
Number of scaffolds that are longer than, or equal to, the N50 length.
Scaffold length at which 50% of total bases in assembly are in scaffolds of that length or greater.
Scaffold length at which 75% of total bases in assembly are in contigs of that length or greater.
scaffold length at which 90% of total bases in assembly are in contigs of that length or greater.
Number of scaffolds.
Number of spanned gaps (i.e. gaps within a scaffold).
Number of chromosomes or plasmids, unplaced/unlocalized scaffolds, alt_loci scaffolds, and patch scaffolds.
Total length of gaps.
Total sequence length including bases and gaps.
Total length excluding gaps.
Number of unspanned gaps (i.e., gaps between scaffolds).
Name of assembly specified by submitter.
Name of organism specified by submitter.
NCBI taxonomy identifier.
Individual, institution, or consortium that submitted the assembly.
Date assembly was released in the INSDC (DDBJ, ENA, or GenBank) databases.
BioSample identifier.
Ploidy information for genome.
Specifies if current assembly was a major, minor, or patch release.
Highest level of assembly for any object in the assembly (complete genome, scaffold, or contig).
Flag indicating if the goal of the assembly was to represent the complete genome (full) or only part of it (partial).
GenBank assembly accesion.
Flag indicating if RefSeq and GenBank assemblies are identical.
Number of coding regions in genome.
Number of tRNA genes identified in genome.
Number of ncRNA genes identified in genome.
Number of rRNA genes identified in genome.
Number of 16S rRNA genes identified in genome.
Specifies the genetic code used for translation.
NCBI taxonomy string.
NCBI type material.
NCBI strain information for the assembly report
